description: A tiny dull-green plastic tear-open packet.  Among the yellow text, the brand name Celox and "hemostatic granules" stand out immediately.  On the back, there are instructions for application of the hemostatic it contains.
//weight: weight of the entire package (with powder) is listed as 0.634 oz = 17.974 g
15 g is the weight of the powder
therefore, 2.974 g ≈ 3 g is the weight of the package separately

notes: height (depth) estimated based on material used
height used in source is likely that of the thickest point of the filled bag

pocket_data.//max_contains_weight: even though used for 15 g of powder, it looks like it can hold a bit more than that

description: A small military-green plastic tear-open packet.  The white text says "NAR Emergency Trauma Dressing (ETD™) 4″"; underneath, on black background, next to a logo of an eagle flying over a medical cross, it says "North American Rescue".  On the back, there are instructions for application of the trauma dressing it contains.
//weight: guessed based on size and previously-filed packages

pocket_data.//max_contains_volume: slightly more than the trauma dressing it's meant for, since the packet is vacuum-fitted to the dressing, but also can't be resealed to full height after being torn open
pocket_data.//max_contains_weight: even though used for ~75 g of trauma dressing, it looks like it can hold a bit more than that

description: A small white plastic tear-open packet with a red left border.  Under the logo of QuikClot, the text says "Bleeding Control Dressing™".  On the back, there are instructions for application of the hemostatic trauma dressing it contains.
//weight: guessed based on size and previously-filed packages

pocket_data.//max_contains_volume: slightly more than the hemostatic dressing it's meant for, since the packet is vacuum-fitted to the dressing, but also can't be resealed to full height after being torn open
pocket_data.//max_contains_weight: even though used for ~15 g of trauma dressing, it looks like it can hold a bit more than that
